text: 1. Bâdhva 1 says, there are four persons (to be meditated on and worshipped).

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 2. The person of the body, the person of the metres, the person of the Veda, and the Great person.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 3. What we call the person of the body is this corporeal self. Its essence is the incorporeal conscious self.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 4. What we call the person of the metres is this collection of letters (the Veda). Its essence is the vowel a.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 5. What we call the person of the Veda is (the mind) by which we know the Vedas, the Ri g-veda, Ya g ur-veda, and Sâma-veda. Its essence is Brahman 2 (m.)

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 6. Therefore let one chose a Brahman-priest who is full of Brahman (the Veda), and is able to see any flaw in the sacrifice.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 7. What we call the Great person is the year, which causes some beings to fall together, and causes others to grow up. Its essence is yonder sun.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 8. One should know that the incorporeal conscious self and yonder sun are both one and the same. Therefore the sun appears to every man singly (and differently).

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 9. This has also been declared by a Ri shi (Rv. I, 115, 1):--

translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 10. 'The bright face of the gods arose, the eye of Mitra, Varu n a, and Agni; it filled heaven and earth

text: and the sky,--the sun is the self of all that rests and moves.'

translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 11. 'This I think to be the regular Sa m hitâ as conceived by me,' thus said Bâdhva.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 1 (SBE01): Aitareya-Âranyaka: ... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 12. For the Bahv ri k as consider him (the self) in the great hymn (mahad uktha), the Adhvaryus in the sacrificial fire, the Kh andogas in the Mahâvrata ceremony. Him they see in this earth, in heaven, in the air, in the ether, in the water, in herbs, in trees, in the moon, in the stars, in all beings. Him alone they call Brahman.

text: 13. That self which consists of sight, hearing, metre, mind, and speech is like unto the year.
